chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ty D Krueger Washington was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Huber with standard release conditions. Sentence credit of 1 day is granted. 
-Sentence commencing on 09-23-2022 by 6:00pm.
-Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
-Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing on 02-01-2023 and each month thereafter. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

-Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid along with payment plan. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff 
 Department. 
-Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Sheriff's Department. 
-Transcript fee to be forwarded to the Waukesha Co District Attorney's office.

records.addlTxt:
10:14 AM  Defendant Ty D Krueger Washington in court.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court for Ty D Krueger Washington.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 2 and 3. 
Court dismisses by operation of law Count 4. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 22TR3003 and 22TR3004

Court orders the following:
90 DAYS   in the waukesha county jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to report to the huber facility by 6 pm. on 9/23/22
1 day credit.

FINE: $ 1229.00
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $36.05 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $8.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting 2/1/23 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  Civil Judgment to enter

D/L REVOCATION: 16 months;
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 16 months;

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

This may be transferred to County of residence.
